title: Valid Anagram
description:
Valid Anagram

Problem

Given two strings s and t, return true if t is an anagram of s, and false otherwise.

An anagram is a word or phrase formed by rearranging the letters of a different word or phrase, typically using all the original letters exactly once.

Examples:

  • If s = "anagram" and t = "nagaram", the output should be true.
  • If s = "rat" and t = "car", the output should be false.

python.solution_text: The most efficient approach is to count character frequencies. We can create dictionaries to track the occurrence of each character in both strings and compare them. This approach has O(n) time complexity and O(1) space complexity (since there are at most 26 lowercase English letters).

javascript.solution_text: The most efficient approach is to count character frequencies. We can create objects to track the occurrence of each character in both strings and compare them. This approach has O(n) time complexity and O(1) space complexity.
